TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi FileListBoxArray extends Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray implements class System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider
Public Class FileListBoxArray Inherits BaseControlArray Implements IExtenderProvider

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")

Docs.summary: Provides a control array of controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `FileListBox` class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 `FileListBox` array. It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you instantiate a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray>, you must also call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.SetIndex%2A> method to create the initial element in the array.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.returns: if is a member of the control array; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `CanExtend` method can be used to determine whether a specific <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control is the base element of the control array from which the other elements were cloned.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a drag-and-drop operation is completed.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Occurs when an object is dragged into the control's bounds.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `DragEnter` event is raised when the user first drags the mouse pointer over the control during a drag-and-drop operation.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when an object is dragged out of the control's bounds.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `DragLeave` event is raised when the user drags the mouse pointer out of the control or the user cancels the current drag-and-drop operation.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when an object is dragged over the control's bounds.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `DragOver` event is raised when the mouse pointer moves within the bounds of the control during a drag-and-drop operation.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a visual aspect of an owner-drawn changes.

remarks.format:

For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enabled%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is entered.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SelectNextControl%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:
`Enter`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:
`Enter`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave>
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Occurs during a drag operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `GiveFeedback` event is raised when a drag-and-drop operation is started. By using the `GiveFeedback` event, the source of a drag event can modify the appearance of the mouse pointer in order to give the user visual feedback during a drag-and-drop operation.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the user requests help for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `HelpRequested` event is typically raised when the user presses the F1 key or an associated context-sensitive Help button is clicked.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(Index As Short) As FileListBox

Docs.param: A that specifies the position of an element of the control array.
Docs.summary: Gets a specific element of a by index. Read-only.
Docs.value: A at the specified in the control array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Item` property is the default property for a control array. Therefore, the following lines of code are equivalent.
```vb MsgBox(CStr(FileListBoxArray.Item(1).Text)) MsgBox(CStr(FileListBoxArray(1).Text)) ```
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a key is pressed and the control has focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Key events occur in the following order:
`KeyDown`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp>
To handle keyboard events only at the form level and not enable controls to receive keyboard events, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs.Handled%2A> property in the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress> event-handling method to `true`.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a key is pressed and the control has focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Key events occur in the following order:
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown>
`KeyPress`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp>
The `KeyPress` event is not raised by non-character keys; however, the non-character keys do raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp> events.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs.KeyChar%2A> property to sample keystrokes at run time and to consume or modify a subset of common keystrokes.
To handle keyboard events only at the form level and not enable controls to receive keyboard events, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs.Handled%2A> property in the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress> event-handling method to `true`.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a key is released and the control has focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Key events occur in the following order:
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress>
`KeyUp`
To handle keyboard events only at the form level and not enable controls to receive keyboard events, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs.Handled%2A> property in the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress> event-handling method to `true`.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a control should reposition its child controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Layout` event occurs when child controls are added or removed, when the bounds of the control changes, and when other changes occur that can affect the layout of the control. The layout event can be suppressed by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SuspendLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ResumeLayout%2A> methods. Suspending layout enables you to perform multiple actions on a control without having to perform a layout for each change. For example, if you resize and move a control, each operation would raise a `Layout` event.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the input focus leaves the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SelectNextControl%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enter>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
`Leave`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enter>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
`Leave`
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is raised if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Location%2A> property is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Docs.summary: Occurs every time an owner-drawn item has to be drawn and when the sizes of the list items are determined.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can create an event handler for this event to specify the size an item is made before it is drawn in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBoxArray.DrawItem> event.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the control and a mouse button is pressed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Mouse events occur in the following order:
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseEnter>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseMove>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseHover>
`MouseDown`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseUp>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseLeave>
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Mouse events occur in the following order:
`MouseEnter`
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseMove>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseHover> / <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseDown> / <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseUp>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseLeave>

They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer rests on the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A typical use of `MouseHover` is to display a tool tip when the mouse pauses on a control within a specified area around the control (the "hover rectangle"). The pause required for this event to be raised is specified in milliseconds by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.MouseHoverTime%2A> property.
The `MouseHover` event is defined and detected in connection with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.MouseHoverSize%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SystemInformation.MouseHoverTime%2A> properties.
Mouse events occur in the following order:
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseEnter>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseMove>
`MouseHover`
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseDown> / <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseUp>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseLeave>
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

remarks.format:

<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseMove>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseHover> / <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.MouseDown> / <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel>

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Occurs when the path is changed by setting the or property in code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use a `PathChange` event procedure to respond to path changes in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control. When you assign a string that contains a new path to the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName%2A> property, the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control invokes the `PathChange` event.
[!INCLUDE[Note_compatibility](~/includes/note-compatibility-md.md)]

Docs.summary: Occurs when the file listing pattern, such as "*.\*", is changed by setting the or property in code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use a `PatternChange` event procedure to respond to pattern changes in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> control. When you assign a string that contains a new pattern to the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.FileName%2A> property, the `FileListBox` invokes the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox.PathChange> event.

Docs.summary: Occurs during a drag-and-drop operation and enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `QueryContinueDrag` event is raised when there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state during a drag-and-drop operation. The `QueryContinueDrag` event enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs during a drag-and-drop operation and enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `QueryContinueDrag` event is raised when there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state during a drag-and-drop operation. The `QueryContinueDrag` event enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is resized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To determine the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Size%2A> of the resized control, you can cast the `sender` parameter of the <xref:System.EventArgs> data to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> and get its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Size%2A> property (or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> properties individually).
To handle custom layouts, use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Layout> event instead of the `Resize` event. The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Layout> event is raised in response to a `Resize` event, but also in response to other changes that affect the layout of the control.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. remarks.format:
## Remarks The `SetIndex` method should only be called when you are creating the initial element in the control array. To add subsequent elements, call the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.Load%2A> method and specify the `Index`.

For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control style changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `StyleChanged` event occurs when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles> flags have been added or changed.
This event is raised if the control style is changed by either a programmatic modification or user interaction.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is finished validating.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SelectNextControl%2A> methods, or by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl.ActiveControl%2A> property to the current form, focus events occur in the following order:
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Enter>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Leave>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating>
`Validated`
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Enter>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Leave>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating>
`Validated`
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CausesValidation%2A> property is set to `false`, the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating> and `Validated` events are suppressed.
If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> is set to `true` in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating> event delegate, all events that would usually occur after the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating> event are suppressed.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is validating.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Select%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.SelectNextControl%2A> methods, or by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl.ActiveControl%2A> property to the current form, focus events occur in the following order:
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Enter>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Leave>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validated>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Focus%2A> method, focus events occur in the following order:
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Enter>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.GotFocus>
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Leave>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating>
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validated>
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CausesValidation%2A> property is set to `false`, the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating> and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validated> events are suppressed.
If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> is set to `true` in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating> event delegate, all events that would usually occur after the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBoxArray.Validating> event are suppressed.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
